data.Title: Perplexity Launches Revenue Sharing Program Amid Plagiarism Concerns
data.Description: Perplexity is launching a program to share ad revenue with publishing partners following weeks of plagiarism accusations. When Perplexity features content from these publishers in response to user queries, the publishers will receive a share of the ad revenue.

data.Title: Google Advises Against Switching M-Dot URLs to Canonical
data.Description: Google's John Mueller reiterated that you should not switch your m-dot URLs to be the canonical URL, even though Google is fully switched over to mobile-first indexing. He said this is because switching it on Google's end would cause many large sites issues.

data.Title: Google Ads Introduces New Features and Integrations
data.Description: Google Ads is rolling out new features, including integration with Google Merchant Center feeds for AI image editing, a new ad format, and click-to-WhatsApp messaging assets.  They are also launching Performance Max reporting updates and AI generation tools.

data.Title: Google Search Updates: X/Twitter Carousel Replacement, Search Appearance Filter Bug Fix
data.Description: Google may be replacing the X/Twitter carousel with a "Latest Posts from" carousel. Additionally, a bug in the Google Search Console performance report that prevents users from seeing all filter options when filtering by Search Appearance will be fixed soon.

data.Title: Google's Antitrust Defense and the Rise of AI Search
data.Description: The emergence of generative AI search engines like SearchGPT could play a role in Google's antitrust defense. The new competition Google faces from generative AI might influence the outcome of a landmark trial where a judge must decide whether Google illegally monopolized online search.

data.Title: Google Search Ranking Volatility Remains High
data.Description: Google Search ranking volatility continues to be very high, leading to speculation about whether Google is testing the next core update.

data.Title: Microsoft Bing Search Ad Revenue Sees 19% Increase
data.Description: Microsoft reported that its search and advertising revenue, driven by Bing, increased by 19% in the fourth quarter of 2024. This marks a significant rebound for Bing, as the last time it experienced such growth was ten quarters ago, in Q3 2022.

data.Title: Google Discover Promotes AI Overviews
data.Description: Google Discover is promoting AI Overviews, with buttons that allow users to jump to the Search results page to view them. Currently, this feature is limited to Olympic topics, but it is expected to expand to other areas.

data.Title: Google Tests Link Icon Citations for AI Overviews
data.Description: Google is experimenting with displaying link icon citations for AI Overviews, similar to how citations are shown for featured snippets.

data.Title: OpenAI Announces SearchGPT Prototype
data.Description: OpenAI has announced SearchGPT, a prototype for a search engine powered by generative AI. This move has sparked discussions about the future of search and the challenges OpenAI faces in competing with Google.

data.Title: Reddit Blocks Bing Search, Limiting Access to Recent Posts
data.Description: Reddit is blocking AI bots from major search engines, including Bing, unless they reach an agreement. This means that Bing users will no longer see recent Reddit posts in their search results.
